description:
Google relies on gTech’s Velocity team (gV) to transform and improve people’s lives through big-bet products and services like Search, Google Assistant, and Actions on Google. Our mission is to activate, accelerate, and scale Google’s biggest bets by being trusted advisors to internal and external partners.

As a Partner Technology Manager, you will be the interface between the Assistant Partner Engineers, who are responsible for partner relationships and other stakeholders, such as Product Management, Engineering and Sales teams. From design and conceptualization through to early piloting and wide-scale deployment, you will oversee the technical implementation and business operations of Google Distribution partnerships for one or more surfaces (e.g Home Audio, Headphones, Auto). You will work on developing product and technical strategy as well as prioritize projects and resources that assist our account management team and partners.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of solution-oriented trusted advisors support millions of customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience in writing/managing system and technical requirements.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with embedded system development.
  • Experience in cloud and server architecture.
  • Experience driving consensus across stakeholders with diverging interests.
  • Familiarity with gRPC, HTTP, and/or Networking.
  • Ability to deal with product, role, and organizational ambiguity.
responsibilities:
• Identify, drive and optimize business growth from new opportunities by leveraging Google technologies.
  • Guarantee the technical aspects of publisher integrations by providing necessary documentation and guidance.
  • Perform implementation reviews, advocate new product features, and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
  • Design effective launch programs with partners to ensure that new products and feature releases are tested before broad-scale deployment.
  • Improve product feature offerings by providing partner feedback to internal cross-functional teams, including Product Management, Engineering, and our Business Solutions teams.
title: Partner Technology Manager
